xdslDevIfIntervalStatsTable.name: xdslDevIfIntervalStatsTable
xdslDevIfIntervalStatsTable.description: The xdslIfStatsTable provides statistics specific to the xDSL link. Statistics are collected on a per port basis and on specified intervals. Hence as such this table is indexed by the xdslDevIfStatsIfIndex and xdslDevIfStatsInterval. Also Statistics are grouped into remote and central statistics. By 'remote' we mean the statistics collected by the device at the customer premises and by 'central' we mean the statistics collected by the device located at the central office. The objects which are not grouped into these two groups are related to both ends of the xDSL link.

xdslDevIfIntervalStatsEntry.name: xdslDevIfIntervalStatsEntry
xdslDevIfIntervalStatsEntry.description: Describes a specific xDSL satistics entry.

xdslDevIfStatsIfIndex.name: xdslDevIfStatsIfIndex
xdslDevIfStatsIfIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to each DSL interface as described in ifTable.

xdslDevIfStatsInterval.name: xdslDevIfStatsInterval
xdslDevIfStatsInterval.description: The value of this object corresponds to the interval of time during which statistics were collected. previousDay(32) will have the statistics collected from 12 midnight previous calendar day

xdslDevIfStatsValid15MinuteIntervalCount.name: xdslDevIfStatsValid15MinuteIntervalCount
xdslDevIfStatsValid15MinuteIntervalCount.description: Reflects the number of 15 minute intervals during which link was up and statistics were received from the remote end

xdslDevIfStatsElapsedTimeLinkUp.name: xdslDevIfStatsElapsedTimeLinkUp
xdslDevIfStatsElapsedTimeLinkUp.description: Reflects the elapsed time since the link was up.

xdslDevIfStatsLinkDownCount.name: xdslDevIfStatsLinkDownCount
xdslDevIfStatsLinkDownCount.description: Reflects the number of times that the xDSL link has gone to a down state. This may be due to shutting down of the customers side of the link. It could also be due to error conditions which result in the going down. A large number of these per unit time (synchronized off sysUpTime) would be indicative of an error condition.

xdslDevIfStatsUpStreamSpeed.name: xdslDevIfStatsUpStreamSpeed
xdslDevIfStatsUpStreamSpeed.description: The speed in the upstream (from the remote to the central site) direction. This object compliments the ifSpeed object in the ifTable which represents the speed in the downstream (from the central to the remote site) direction. The speed is measured in bits per second.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceiverGain.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceiverGain
xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceiverGain.description: Reflects the receiver gain at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecMargin.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecMargin
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecMargin.description: Reflects the margin at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecAttenuationEstim.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecAttenuationEstimate
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecAttenuationEstim.description: Reflects the attenuation estimate at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecTransmitPower.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecTransmitPower
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecTransmitPower.description: Reflects the transmit power at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErrorRate.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErrorRate
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErrorRate.description: Reflects the error rate at the central site. This string will represent a floating point number of the form. [ErrRate][eE][+-][ErrRateBase] where ErrRate and ErrRateBase are integers. In Other Words ErrRate * [10^ -ErrRateBase] shown below are example of the values returned. 123456E-5 = 1.23456 344567e-6 = 0.344567

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredSeconds.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredSeconds
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredSeconds.description: Reflects the errored seconds at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredS.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredSeconds
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredS.description: Reflects the severely errored seconds at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceiverGain.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceiverGain
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceiverGain.description: Reflects the receiver gain at the remote site

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecMargin.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecMargin
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecMargin.description: Reflects the margin at the remote site

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecAttenuationEstima.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecAttenuationEstimate
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecAttenuationEstima.description: Reflects the attenuation estimate at the remote site

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecTransmitPower.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecTransmitPower
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecTransmitPower.description: Reflects the transmit power at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrorRate.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrorRate
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrorRate.description: Reflects the error rate at the remote site. This string will represent a floating point number of the form a.b. [ErrRate][eE][+-][ErrRateBase] where ErrRate and ErrRateBase are integers. In Other Words ErrRate * [10^ -ErrRateBase] shown below are example of the values returned. 123456E-5 = 1.23456 344567e-6 = 0.344567

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredSeconds.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredSeconds
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredSeconds.description: Reflects the errored seconds at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredSe.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredSeconds
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredSe.description: Reflects the severely errored seconds at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsCorrected.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsCorrected
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsCorrected.description: This object reflects the number of octets corrected when reed-solomon is turned on at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsNotCorrected.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsNotCorrected
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteOctetsNotCorrected.description: This object reflects the number of octets not corrected when reed-solomon is turned on at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedKiloOctets.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedKiloOctets
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedKiloOctets.description: The number of octets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the remote site divided by 1000.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedPkts
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteReceivedPkts.description: The number of good packets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrPkts
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErrPkts.description: Reflects the number packet receive with error by the xDSL interface at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteDroppedPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteDroppedPkts
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteDroppedPkts.description: Reflects the number of good packets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the remote site, but have been dropped due to insufficient buffer capacity.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedKiloOctet.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedKiloOctets
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedKiloOctet.description: The number of octets that have been transmitted by the xDSL interface at the remote site divided by 1000.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedPkts
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteTransmittedPkts.description: The number of pkts that have been transmitted by the xDSL interface at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredMinutes.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredMinutes
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecErroredMinutes.description: Reflects the errored minutes at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredM.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredMinutes
xdslDevIfStatsCentralRecSeverelyErroredM.description: Reflects the severely errored minutes at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredMinutes.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredMinutes
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecErroredMinutes.description: Reflects the errored minutes at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredMi.name: xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredMinutes
xdslDevIfStatsRemoteRecSeverelyErroredMi.description: Reflects the severely errored minutes at the remote site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedKiloOctets.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedKiloOctets
xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedKiloOctets.description: The number of octets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the central site divided by 1000.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedKiloOcte.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedKiloOctets
xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedKiloOcte.description: The number of octets that have been transmitted by the xDSL interface at the central site divided by 1000.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedPkts
xdslDevIfStatsCentralTransmittedPkts.description: The number of packets that have been transmitted by the xDSL interface at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedPkts
xdslDevIfStatsCentralReceivedPkts.description: The number of packets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the central site.

xdslDevIfStatsCentralErrPkts.name: xdslDevIfStatsCentralErrPkts
xdslDevIfStatsCentralErrPkts.description: The number of packets that have been received by the xDSL interface at the central site with error.

xdslDevIfConfigTable.name: xdslDevIfConfigTable
xdslDevIfConfigTable.description: The xdslDevIfConfigTable provides config information specific to a xDSL device, or system. The table is indexed by an object which corresponds to ifIndex. These ifIndex entries, themselves, denote and identify specific xdsl interfaces on the board or module. Also the configuration parameters are grouped into two broad categories, 'up' and 'down'. 'up' reflects the upstream direction (from the customer premises to the central office). 'Down' reflects the downstream direction (from the central office to the customer premises)

xdslDevIfConfigEntry.name: xdslDevIfConfigEntry
xdslDevIfConfigEntry.description: Describes a specific xDSL interface entry.

xdslDevIfConfigIfIndex.name: xdslDevIfConfigIfIndex
xdslDevIfConfigIfIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to each xDSL interface as described in ifTable.

xdslDevIfConfigPortSpeedBehaviour.name: xdslDevIfConfigPortSpeedBehaviour
xdslDevIfConfigPortSpeedBehaviour.description: The value of this object corresponds to the behaviour of the specified port. The default value for this object is fixed (1).

xdslDevIfConfigUpFixedPortSpeed.name: xdslDevIfConfigUpFixedPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigUpFixedPortSpeed.description: The value of this object corresponds to the upstream speed of the specified port for fixed port speed behaviour. All the speeds enumerated above are in kbps. If the port speed behaviour is adaptive an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The default value for this object is s1088 (7).

xdslDevIfConfigDownFixedPortSpeed.name: xdslDevIfConfigDownFixedPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigDownFixedPortSpeed.description: The value of this object corresponds to the downstream speed of the specified port for fixed port speed behaviour. All the speeds enumerated above are in kbps. if the port speed behaviour is adaptive an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The default value for this object is s2560 (7).

xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveUpperBoundPortS.name: xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveUpperBoundPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveUpperBoundPortS.description: The value of this object corresponds to the upper bound for the upstream port speed of the specified port for adaptive port speed behaviour. The speeds are measured in kbps. If the port speed behaviour is fixed an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The default value for this object is s1088.

xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveLowerBoundPortS.name: xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveLowerBoundPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigUpAdaptiveLowerBoundPortS.description: The value of this object corresponds to the lower bound for the upstream port speed of the specified port for adaptive port speed behaviour in kbps. If the port speed behaviour is fixed an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The default value for this object s272.

xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveUpperBoundPor.name: xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveUpperBoundPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveUpperBoundPor.description: The value of this object corresponds to the upper bound allowed for the downstream port speed of the specified port for adaptive port speed behaviour. The speeds are measured in kbps. if the port speed behaviour is fixed an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The default value for this object is s2560 (7).

xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveLowerBoundPor.name: xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveLowerBoundPortSpeed
xdslDevIfConfigDownAdaptiveLowerBoundPor.description: The value of this object corresponds to the Minimum lower bound allowed for the downstream port speed of the specified port for adaptive port speed behaviour. If the port speed behaviour is fixed an error of noSuchName will be returned by the agent. The speeds are measured in kbps. The default value for this object is s640(1).

xdslDevIfConfigReedSolomonDownForwardErr.name: xdslDevIfConfigReedSolomonDownForwardErrorCorrection
xdslDevIfConfigReedSolomonDownForwardErr.description: The value of this object corresponds to the Reed-Solomon forward error correction in the downstream direction. The default value of this object should be minimizeError (1).

xdslDevIfConfigMarginThreshold.name: xdslDevIfConfigMarginThreshold
xdslDevIfConfigMarginThreshold.description: The value of this object corresponds to the offset from the startup margin. The threshold margin is calculated by subtracting the offset from the startup margin. Permissible range of values are between -7 and 14. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The default value of this object is 3

xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedHrErrRateThresho.name: xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedHrErrRateThreshold
xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedHrErrRateThresho.description: The value of this object corresponds to the estimated error rate threshold value on an hourly basis. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The default value for this object is 1000.

xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedDayErrRateThresh.name: xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedDayErrRateThreshold
xdslDevIfConfigEstimatedDayErrRateThresh.description: The value of this object corresponds to the estimated error rate threshold value on a daily basis. A value of -9999 disables this threshold check. The default value for this object is 10000

xdslDevIfConfigPortID.name: xdslDevIfConfigPortID
xdslDevIfConfigPortID.description: The value of this object corresponds to 40 character information only field that identifies what the DSL port is connected to (Circuit ID, MDF location, Customer name, etc.)

xdslDevIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold.name: xdslDevIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold
xdslDevIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold.description: The value of this object corresponds to the threshold value for link up-down transitions. If link up-down's exceed this threshold value a xdslLinkupDownTransitions trap is generated. This value would represent the number of link up-down transitions in a 15 minute interval. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The default value for this object is 0

xdslDevIfConfigStartUpMargin.name: xdslDevIfConfigStartUpMargin
xdslDevIfConfigStartUpMargin.description: The value of this object corresponds to the startup value of the margin for a DSL interface (specified by ifIndex). The unit is db (decibels. The higher the margin the better the quality of the line. The default value of this object is 3.

xdslDevIfConfigTxPowerAttenuation.name: xdslDevIfConfigTxPowerAttenuation
xdslDevIfConfigTxPowerAttenuation.description: This value corresponds to the Transmitt Power Attenuation in dB for the access node. This value represents the downstream power level in dB. Permissible range of values are between -6 and 0. The default value of this object is 0 dB. The power levels +3 and +6 may be used in future.

xdslDevIfConfigSnTxPowerAttenuation.name: xdslDevIfConfigSnTxPowerAttenuation
xdslDevIfConfigSnTxPowerAttenuation.description: This value corresponds to the Transmitt Power Attenuation in dB for the service node. This value represents the upstream power level in dB. The default value of this object is -6 dB.

xdslRemoteSysTable.name: xdslRemoteSysTable
xdslRemoteSysTable.description: The Remote System information table. This table is based on the mib-2 system mib.

xdslRemoteSysEntry.name: xdslRemoteSysEntry
xdslRemoteSysEntry.description: Describes a specific xDSL interface Remote Endpoint entry.

xdslRemoteSysIndex.name: xdslRemoteSysIndex
xdslRemoteSysIndex.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysDescr.name: xdslRemoteSysDescr
xdslRemoteSysDescr.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysObjectID.name: xdslRemoteSysObjectID
xdslRemoteSysObjectID.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysUpTime.name: xdslRemoteSysUpTime
xdslRemoteSysUpTime.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysContact.name: xdslRemoteSysContact
xdslRemoteSysContact.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysName.name: xdslRemoteSysName
xdslRemoteSysName.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysLocation.name: xdslRemoteSysLocation
xdslRemoteSysLocation.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysServices.name: xdslRemoteSysServices
xdslRemoteSysServices.description: Refer to the mib-2 system MIB for a description.

xdslRemoteSysCircuitId.name: xdslRemoteSysCircuitId
xdslRemoteSysCircuitId.description: The value of this object reflects the Circuit ID for a Service Node.

xdslRemoteDTEStatusTable.name: xdslRemoteDTEStatusTable
xdslRemoteDTEStatusTable.description: The Remote DTE Status table. This provides status information about the DTE port of the DSL RTUs.

xdslRemoteDTEStatusEntry.name: xdslRemoteDTEStatusEntry
xdslRemoteDTEStatusEntry.description: This provides status information about the DTE port of a specific DSL RTU.

xdslRemoteDTEStatusIndex.name: xdslRemoteDTEStatusIndex
xdslRemoteDTEStatusIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to each DSL interface as described in the ifTable.

xdslRemoteDTEState.name: xdslRemoteDTEState
xdslRemoteDTEState.description: The value of this object reflects the state of the DTE interface of the DSL RTU.

xdslRemoteDTEType.name: xdslRemoteDTEType
xdslRemoteDTEType.description: The value of this object reflects the configuration of the DTE interface of the DSL RTU.

xdslRemoteDTEClockSource.name: xdslRemoteDTEClockSource
xdslRemoteDTEClockSource.description: The value of this object reflects the timing configuration of the DTE interface of the DSL RTU.

xdslRemoteDTEStrobe.name: xdslRemoteDTEStrobe
xdslRemoteDTEStrobe.description: The value of this object reflects the clock edge timing configuration of the DTE interface of the DSL RTU.

xdslRemoteDTELoopbackState.name: xdslRemoteDTELoopbackState
xdslRemoteDTELoopbackState.description: The value of this object reflects the loopback state of the DTE interface of the DSL RTU.

xdslDevMvlIfConfigTable.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigTable
xdslDevMvlIfConfigTable.description: The xdslDevMvlIfConfigTable provides config information specific to a xDSL(MVL) device, or system. The table is indexed by an object which corresponds to ifIndex. These ifIndex entries, themselves, denote and identify specific xdsl(Mvl) interfaces on the board or module.

xdslDevMvlIfConfigEntry.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigEntry
xdslDevMvlIfConfigEntry.description: Describes a specific xDSL(MVL) interface entry.

xdslDevMvlIfConfigIfIndex.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigIfIndex
xdslDevMvlIfConfigIfIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to each xDSL(MVL) interface as described in ifTable.

xdslDevMvlIfConfigUpperBoundPortSpeed.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigUpperBoundPortSpeed
xdslDevMvlIfConfigUpperBoundPortSpeed.description: The value of this object corresponds to the upper bound port speed of the specified port. The speeds are measured in kbps. Supported speeds are 128, 192, 256, 320, 384, 448, 512 576, 640, 704, 768. The default value of this object is 768

xdslDevMvlIfConfigMarginThreshold.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigMarginThreshold
xdslDevMvlIfConfigMarginThreshold.description: The value of this object corresponds to the Margin threshold value. Permissible range of values are between -5 and 9. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The default value is 3

xdslDevMvlIfConfigPortID.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigPortID
xdslDevMvlIfConfigPortID.description: The value of this object corresponds to 40 character information only field that identifies what the DSL port is connected to (Circuit ID, MDF location, Customer name, etc.)

xdslDevMvlIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshol.name: xdslDevMvlIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold
xdslDevMvlIfLinkUpDownTransitionThreshol.description: The value of this object corresponds to the threshold value for link up-down transitions. If link up-down's exceed this threshold value a xdslLinkupDownTransitions trap is generated. This value would represent the number of link up-down transitions in a 15 minute interval. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The default value for this object is 0

xdslDevMvlIfConfigOnHookTxPowerAttenuati.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigOnHookTxPowerAttenuation
xdslDevMvlIfConfigOnHookTxPowerAttenuati.description: This value corresponds to the On-hook Transmitt Power Attenuation in dB for the access node and the service node. This value represents both downstream and upstream power level in dB while the phone is On-hook. Permissible range of values are between -2 and +10. The default value of this object is 10 dB.

xdslDevMvlIfConfigOffHookTxPowerAttenuat.name: xdslDevMvlIfConfigOffHookTxPowerAttenuation
xdslDevMvlIfConfigOffHookTxPowerAttenuat.description: This value corresponds to the Off-hook Transmitt Power Attenuation in dB for the access node and the service node. This value represents both downstream and upstream power level in dB while the phone is Off-hook. Permissible range of values are between -2 and +7. The default value of this object is 7 dB.

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTable.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTable
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTable.description: The xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTable provides customer accounting information on each DSL port. Network Access Providers can accurately bill their end station DSL customers by the amount of usage. The table is indexed by ifIndex and xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountInterval The ifIndex identifies specific xdsl interface on the device and xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountInterval specifies the accounting information is for the current day or the previous day. Customer data excludes all traffic used for management purpose.

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountEntry.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountEntry
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountEntry.description: Provides customer related accounting information specific to an xDSL interface entry.

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountIfIndex.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountIfIndex
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountIfIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to each xDSL interface as described in ifTable.

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountInterval.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountInterval
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountInterval.description: The value of this object corresponds to the interval of time during which customer accounting data were collected. Day starts at 12.01 midnight

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountRecKiloOctets.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountRecKiloOctets
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountRecKiloOctets.description: Customer data received at the AN's DSL port in 1000 Octets. The default value of this object is 0

xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTrxKiloOctets.name: xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTrxKiloOctets
xdslDevNAPCustomerAccountTrxKiloOctets.description: Customer data transmitted over the AN's DSL port in 1000 Octets. The default value of this object is 0

xdslDevIDSLConfigTable.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigTable
xdslDevIDSLConfigTable.description: The xdslDevIDSLConfigTable provides configuration specific to the IDSL link.

xdslDevIDSLConfigEntry.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigEntry
xdslDevIDSLConfigEntry.description: Describes a specific IDSL configuration entry.

xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeedBehaviour.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeedBehaviour
xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeedBehaviour.description: The value of this object corresponds to the behaviour of the specified port. The default value for this object is fixed (1).

xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeed.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeed
xdslDevIDSLConfigPortSpeed.description: The value of this object corresponds to both upstream and downstream speed of the specified port. All the speeds are in kbps. The default value for this object is 128 kbps.

xdslDevIDSLConfigPortID.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigPortID
xdslDevIDSLConfigPortID.description: The value of this object corresponds to 40 character information only field that identifies what the DSL port is connected to (Circuit ID, MDF location, Customer name, etc.)

xdslDevIDSLTimingPortTransceiverMode.name: xdslDevIDSLTimingPortTransceiverMode
xdslDevIDSLTimingPortTransceiverMode.description: The transceiver mode selected on the timing source port. Only one IDSL port can be set to NT mode. This timing will then be distributed to all other IDSL ports in the chassis that are set to LT. The selected xdslDevIDSLPrimaryTimingSourcePort provides clocking signals to the DSLAM when the transceiver mode is set to Network timing. The port selected for Network Timing mode will probably not used for customer data, but will receive a 2.048 Mhz Network clocking signal from a central office timing source and distribute this timing to other IDSL port cards.

xdslDevIDSLConfigMarginThreshold.name: xdslDevIDSLConfigMarginThreshold
xdslDevIDSLConfigMarginThreshold.description: The value of this object corresponds to the Margin threshold value. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The value range of this object is -5 to 10. The default value is 3

xdslDevIDSLLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold.name: xdslDevIDSLLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold
xdslDevIDSLLinkUpDownTransitionThreshold.description: The value of this object corresponds to the threshold value for link up-down transitions. If link up-down's exceed this threshold value a xdslLinkupDownTransitions trap is generated. This value would represent the number of link up-down transitions in a 15 minute interval. A value of -9999 disables the threshold check. The value range of this object is 0 to 1000. The default value for this object is 0

xdslLinkDownReason.name: xdslLinkDownReason
xdslLinkDownReason.description: This entry contains the reason as to why the DSL Link went down. This information is obtained when the DSL Link is coming up

xdslRemoteInjectionType.name: xdslRemoteInjectionType
xdslRemoteInjectionType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the remote injection type

xdslLinkUpDownTransitions.name: xdslLinkUpDownTransitions
xdslLinkUpDownTransitions.description: This trap signifies that the sending protocol entity recognizes that one of the xDSL communication links is in a fluctuating state. This is a trap of 'minor' class.

xdslPortSpeedLow.name: xdslPortSpeedLow
xdslPortSpeedLow.description: This trap signifies that the port speed of the xDSL link has dropped below a threshold value. This is a trap of 'warning' class

xdslPortSpeedNormal.name: xdslPortSpeedNormal
xdslPortSpeedNormal.description: This trap signifies that the port speed of the xDSL link has has gone above the threshold value. This is a trap of 'warning' class. This trap compliments the xdslPortSpeedLow Trap

xdslMarginLow.name: xdslMarginLow
xdslMarginLow.description: This trap signifies that the margin estimate is below a customer set threshold value. this is a trap of 'minor' class.

xdslMarginNormal.name: xdslMarginNormal
xdslMarginNormal.description: This trap signifies that the margin estimate has gone above a customer set threshold value. this is a trap of 'minor' class. this trap compliments the xdslMarginLow trap

xdslErrorRateHigh.name: xdslErrorRateHigh
xdslErrorRateHigh.description: This trap signifies that the error rate estimates is above a customer set threshold value. This is a trap of 'minor' class.

xdslErrorRateNormal.name: xdslErrorRateNormal
xdslErrorRateNormal.description: This trap signifies that the error rate estimates gone below a customer set threshold value. This is a trap of 'minor' class. This trap compliments the xdslErrorRateHigh trap.

xdslPortFailure.name: xdslPortFailure
xdslPortFailure.description: This trap signifies that the processor detected a bad modem set. This is a trap of 'major' class

xdslPortOperational.name: xdslPortOperational
xdslPortOperational.description: This trap signifies that the modem set which was bad is now operational. This is a trap of 'major' class. This trap compliments the xdslPortFailure trap.

xdslTestStart.name: xdslTestStart
xdslTestStart.description: This trap signifies that a diagnostic test has started on one of the ports

xdslTestOver.name: xdslTestOver
xdslTestOver.description: This trap signifies that the test has completed on one of the ports. This trap compliments the xdslTestStart trap.

xdslRtuTypeMismatch.name: xdslRtuTypeMismatch
xdslRtuTypeMismatch.description: The RTU configured in the DSL card does NOT match with the RTU connected to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

xdslRtuTypeMismatchClear.name: xdslRtuTypeMismatchClear
xdslRtuTypeMismatchClear.description: The RTU configured in the DSL card does match with the RTU connected to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

xdslRtuSelfTestFail.name: xdslRtuSelfTestFail
xdslRtuSelfTestFail.description: A self test failure from the RTU connected to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

xdslRtuLastGasp.name: xdslRtuLastGasp
xdslRtuLastGasp.description: Card received LastGap message from SN followed by a link down condition one minute later.

xdslSNDeviceFail.name: xdslSNDeviceFail
xdslSNDeviceFail.description: Operating software has detected an internal device failure. The RTU is still operating.

xdslSNSelfTestFail.name: xdslSNSelfTestFail
xdslSNSelfTestFail.description: Failure of the RTU's hardware components. This trap is only set if the hardware failure still allows sending traps.

xdslLinkDownAnalysisTrap.name: xdslLinkDownAnalysisTrap
xdslLinkDownAnalysisTrap.description: This trap signifies that the sending protocol entity recognizes that the xDSL communication link is up. LinkDownReason conveys the reason for link down.

xdslRemoteInjectionFailureTrap.name: xdslRemoteInjectionFailureTrap
xdslRemoteInjectionFailureTrap.description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters to SN failed It is of warning class

xdslRemoteInjectionIncompatibleTrap.name: xdslRemoteInjectionIncompatibleTrap
xdslRemoteInjectionIncompatibleTrap.description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters is not supported by the SN. It is of warning class

xdslLossOfNetworkTimingSignalTrap.name: xdslLossOfNetworkTimingSignalTrap
xdslLossOfNetworkTimingSignalTrap.description: This trap is generated by an IDSL port card when it detects that the line supplying timing signals to the chassis on the port designated as NT has dropped. The ifIndex corresponds to the port designated as NT.
